definition: to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: The hulk of feudalism will not quickly fade away.
sentences.chinese: 封建主义的残余不会很快消失。

sentences.english: But feudalism ideology hides actually by one remaining form.
sentences.chinese: 但封建主义思想意识却以一种残余的形式隐躲下来。

sentences.english: What do we mean by feudalism ?
sentences.chinese: 我们说的封建主义，是指什么呢？

sentences.english: Of course, surviving feudal influences are not manifested only in such defects.
sentences.chinese: 封建主义的残余影响当然不止这些。

sentences.english: For this he decided to break with his feudalistic family .
sentences.chinese: 为此他决定和他的封建主义家庭决裂。

sentences.english: Taxation facilitated commerce and agriculture more than proto-feudalism.
sentences.chinese: 税收促进商业和农业超过原封建主义。

sentences.english: He himself comes from the feudal caste.
sentences.chinese: 他自己来自于封建主阶层。

sentences.english: All of these are the survivals of feudalism and capitalism.
sentences.chinese: 所有的这一切都是封建主义和资本主义再现。

sentences.english: Therefore, opposing feudalism is a fundamental task of the Chinese revolution.
sentences.chinese: 所以反对封建主义是中国革命的一个根本任务。

pinyin: Shen2 sheng4 Luo2 ma3 Di4 guo2

definition: native state (term used by British Colonial power to refer to independent states of India or Africa)

pinyin: Na4 bu4 le4 si1 wang2 guo2

definition: the Church (as Royal Court)/the Holy See/the Vatican
Abbasid Empire (750-1258), successor of the Umayyad caliphate
